summary: Medicare paid $7.1 billion for 433 million lab tests in 2017, and typically paid higher rates than private insurers. Medicare is required to use a new methodology to establish payment rates in 2018, which tries to address this issue. However, we found that this new methodology could cause Medicare to pay billions more than is necessary for several reasons. For example, it uses maximum payment...
title: Medicare Laboratory Tests: Implementation of New Rates May Lead to Billions in Excess Payments
